page.title: 10THE MANORS OLD PEOPLE'S HOME
page.content: There is not a garden at the Manors just a few shrubs around the border. There is one large bench which holds about six pensioners at a time. Inside the 36 flatlets there are no modern appliances, particularly gas, as the pensioners would find it hard to adjust to these modern ways. There is a large games area where the pensioners can listen to music, play dominoes, read or even play bingo. It is rather like a hospital as there are lots of well cleaned crridors. The building is painted once every three years, but the pensioners must arrange to have their own centrally heated flats decorated. It is very rare that all the flats are occupied at once.
